Hey 👋,

We are experiencing some issues on and off w/ Claude Sonnet 3.5 within the Copilot Modules of all the applications.

If you are experiencing this issue please first:
1. change the Model runtime to OpenAI or Gemini as these are working very consistently.
2. Ensure you sign in to the Pieces Ecosystem, this will ensure that you have a larger rate limit than those users who are NOT authenticated.

Please feel free to comment in this thread if you are experiencing similar issues!

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[https://disk.yandex.ru/i/Z_U0FzYA8NBrNg](url)
There is a video here that describes the problem
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** @Iliya3ProX reported an issue where the Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) in Pieces OS wouldn't enable. They provided a video demonstrating the problem.

**Key points raised:**

* Downloaded local LLM state was overriding saved selected model.
* Issue persisted after updating to version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of desktop application.
* After update, a page titled "Woohoo PiecesOS 11.0 is released 🎉" opens in the browser after each reboot.
* @AyomideA-S confirmed experiencing the same issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mason-at-pieces requested Pieces OS logs for investigation.
* @mack-at-pieces identified and fixed the issue in downloaded LLMs overriding saved data.
* A patch was released by EOD on 2024-12-19.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The fix was implemented in version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of the desktop application.
* @Iliya3ProX reported the issue persists even after the update. 
* @AyomideA-S confirmed the same issue.
* The cause of the issue after the update is unclear and requires further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* @Iliya3ProX provided logs and a video demonstrating the issue.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and provided a timeline for the fix.
* Further investigation is needed to address the issue after the update.

common_issues.title: Connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments like Docker containers and VS Code remote development. This is often due to firewall restrictions or the Pieces OS instance not being accessible from the remote environment. Solutions include configuring firewalls, setting the `pieces.customUrl` setting in VS Code, and ensuring Pieces OS is running and accessible.

related_issues.title: Can't connect from dev container
related_issues.text: Can't connect from dev container ### Software Pieces OS, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 9.0.7 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. # Issue description Hi, Pieces OS is working fine in VSCode (extension version: `v1.16.2`), until I load into a dev container. VSCode gives me these notifications: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/48d644e3-c170-4caf-8258-d96f2323c2cf) ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/a393edaf-8405-4581-9807-3ae093d078e3) Pieces explorer looks like this: # Attempted fixes I tried to turn off / disable macOS native firewall as well as [Lulu](https://objective-see.org/products/lulu.html) completely, but the issue still persists. Not sure how to make inbound firewall rule for port 1000 on macOS, where you need to specify an exact application associated with firewall rules. # One strange behavior Now, one thing is strange - **if PiecesOS is turned off before opening VSCode and I open a VSCode in dev container straight away, PiecesOS automatically starts and shows me the welcome window**: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/30979983/07cd8e60-1b29-4757-8204-c82d87cd39ce) Does it mean, that the VSCode extension inside dev container (i.e. docker container) can communicate with host and startup the application? If so, why does it fail to communicate further? ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key points raised:** * User (Muzosh) unable to connect to Pieces OS from Docker container using VS Code Pieces extension. * User identified firewall rules as a potential issue and tried debugging using `curl`. * Caleb-at-pieces suggested using `pieces://launch` URI to test connection from container. * User confirmed connection was successful and setting `custom url` to `http://host.docker.internal:1000` solved the issue. * Eliezedeck mentioned the issue also affects Gitpod and other remote development environments. * Caleb-at-pieces acknowledged the need for better support for remote environments. **Problems identified:** * VS Code extension relies on `host.docker.internal` which may not be available outside of Docker container. * User experience suffers due to lack of proper support for remote environments. **Solutions proposed/implemented:** * Using `pieces://launch` URI to test connection from Docker container. * Setting `custom url` to `http://host.docker.internal:1000` to connect to Pieces OS. * Caleb-at-pieces is working on a solution to avoid requiring Pieces OS to be running before launching VS Code. * A notification has been added to the VS Code extension to guide users on connecting to a remote Pieces OS instance. **Current status/outcome:** * The user's issue was resolved by setting the `custom url` option. * Caleb-at-pieces is working on improved support for remote environments. **Additional notes:** * The user's suggestion of allowing multiple URLs in the `pieces.customUrl` setting will be considered in the future. * The user's suggestion of adding documentation on connecting to a remote Pieces OS instance has been implemented.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS 11 performance issues:** This is the most common issue reported by users, impacting Copilot functionality and overall user experience.

**Investigate and address Copilot module errors:** Users are experiencing issues with Copilot, particularly with Claude 3.5 Sonnet. Resolving these errors will significantly improve user satisfaction.

**Improve support for remote environments:** Users face challenges connecting to Pieces OS from Docker containers and VS Code remote development. Enhance documentation and provide clear solutions for these scenarios.
**Review and address LTM functionality:**  Ticket #540 highlights persistent issues with LTM not saving the selected model. Resolving this will improve the LTM experience.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide specific details about performance issues, including their system configurations and steps to reproduce the problem. This will help in identifying the root causes and implementing effective solutions.
